oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Differences in physical properties of two clay soils
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Alakukku, Laura
Ristolainen, Antti
Nuutinen, Visa
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soil quality
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We studied the physical properties of two clay soils (J1 and J2) having relatively similar texture but differing cultivation properties J2 being more sensitive to dry and wet conditions. The general assumption that the productivity of heavy clay soils is mainly threatened by excessive wetness holds in both fields.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Alakukku, Laura; Ristolainen, Antti and Nuutinen, Visa (2008) Differences in physical properties of two clay soils. In: NJF Report, Nordic Association of Agricultural Scientists, 4 (3), p. 16.
